> Since we're talking stylistic issues here, I would point out that

gnore is

ivalent in TestNG is an attribute:  @Test(enabled =3D false),

s more sense in my opinion.  An even better choice is to put

in an ignored group (@Test(groups =3D {"ignored"}) and then exclude

roup

rts list

y 
easy to

=
In the interest of emphasizing common ground - I also find "@Ignore" 
to be=
 a bit non-descript.  For TestUtil we offered two (functionally 
equivalent=
) choices for each (JavaDoc) annotation:

    @excludeClass
    @excludeCla=
ssFromTestUtilVerification
    @excludeSetter
    @excludeSetterFromTestUti=
lVerification

The verbose versions don't leave much room for interpretatio=
n!
